Key Match Events: Archer helped himself to three for 23 in the first innings
Jason Roy hit form with a bullish 49 at the top of the order
Jonny Bairstow and Dawid Malan finished things off with a handful of sixes
Chris Jordan closed out the innings, taking Shreyas Iyer with him courtesy of a fine catch from Malan
Pre-Game Insights: Eoin Morgan exacted a first dose of revenge for the Test series defeat
Moeen Ali was left out of the XI
Adil Rashid got his first ever new ball stint in the format
Mark Wood joined the attack and cramped Shikhar Dhawan from round the wicket
India badly needed Axar Patel to reprise the habit of instant breakthroughs that proved so devastating in the Test series
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Morgan started the evening by springing a couple of surprises
Roy and Jos Buttler shut Axar Patel's first over down successfully
Bairstow had some fun with two mighty sixes down the ground that left Chahal nursing an economy rate of 11
Malan anchored at three and passed over to Bairstow to end things with a big hit off Sundar
Miscellaneous Highlights: The stage was set in the first innings as England restricted the hosts to 124 for seven
That left India on 22 for three, with a quite outrageous reverse-scooped six from Rishabh Pant against Archer their only real moment of joy
Shreyas Iyerâ€™s measured 67 shouldered almost all of the responsibility for making things competitive
